name: Camel Aissani
title: Software Development Enthusiast
slogan: Building the future, one line of code at a time

experience.description: Architected and delivered a next-generation query modeler for the marketing campaign classic platform, significantly enhancing performance and user experience. Contributed to the migration of customers from a legacy platform, helping unblock key transitions and enabling a smooth upgrade. Actively documented decisions, shared technical insights with the team, and led discussions on architectural strategies to drive consensus and maintain high engineering standards.

Run the web team of 8 developers who deliver the Journey application. I collaborate with different teams across the globe (US, India and France) to ease and to ensure the deliveries of the product features. I support my team to follow the best practices like writing technical specs, writing tests (unit tests/e2e tests), doing code reviews.

Drove and rewrote the Journey web application in React. With the team, we redefined the architecture to get a more robust and flexible product. We successfully delivered the new application without any downtime in production.

Created a CI/CD service for SAP developers. I made many technical proposals to enhance our application according to the business challenges. I wrote Docker images, Python packages, Jenkins pipelines for piloting build tools like maven, npm and pip. I presented and synchronized our developments with our worldwide team (Germany, Bulgaria, Canada, India, Singapore).

Maintained and enhanced a Risk Management application for financial market (K+TP). I improved the general performance of the product written in Java and C++. I participated in rewriting the back office web application in Flex 4.

Worked on a Combat Management System for warships. I ran a team of 10 developers to create a Java engine to manage the data flow of warship sensors. I created a Java Swing user interface to emulate warship instruments and sailors.
Created many Java Swing user interfaces for the Business Intelligence Platform. I wrote some C++ wrappers on top of servers to ensure communication between front-end and back-end.

education.degree: Master's Degree, Computer science and electronics Engineering
